items.title: What It Is
items.description: The brain of the computer.

items.title: Fetch
items.description: Get the instructions.

items.title: Decode
items.description: Understand what to do.

items.title: Execute
items.description: Do the task.

items.title: Store
items.description: Save the results.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: Specially made for graphics and high-resolution tasks.

items.title: Basic Work
items.description: Handles gaming and high-quality images quickly.

items.title: Example
items.description: Gaming might take 5 minutes; on a CPU, it could take 50 hours.

items.title: Handles Many Tasks Together
items.description: Good at doing many things at once.

items.title: Used in AI
items.description: Helps with fast number processing for AI tasks.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: Special chip for machine learning and AI.

items.title: Basic Work
items.description: Speeds up tasks like text processing in AI.

items.title: Power Efficient
items.description: Uses less power compared to CPUs.

items.title: Long Battery Life
items.description: Devices with NPU (e.g., M1, M2 chips) can last 20 hours on battery.

items.title: Role
items.description: Makes machine learning faster and more efficient.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: A way for computers to learn from data using neural networks.

items.title: Learns by Itself
items.description: Neural networks improve by themselves.

items.title: Generative AI
items.description: A type of deep learning that creates new data similar to what it was trained on.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: Models that understand and generate text like humans.

items.title: Use
items.description: Helps in creating content, answering questions, and making intelligent responses.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: Using generative AI in specific areas.

items.title: Characteristics
items.description: Tailors AI to do special tasks and produce specific results.

items.title: What It Is
items.description: A platform for containerization, which helps run software in isolated environments called containers.

items.title: Basic Work
items.description: Docker runs applications in containers that are isolated from the host system.

items.title: Installation
items.description: Install Docker and enable WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux). Verify installation with docker --version.

items.title: To pull images
items.description: Docker images are available at hub.docker.com.

items.title: To run a container
items.description: Use the command docker run [image_name].

items.title: For interactive mode
items.description: Use docker run -it [image_name].

items.title: To build your own image
items.description: Create a Dockerfile and use docker build -t [image_name] .

items.title: Dockerfile
items.description: Write a Dockerfile with base image, e.g., FROM python.

items.title: Copy code
items.description: Copy code to the image with COPY . . .

items.title: Specify command
items.description: Specify the command to run with CMD ["python", "main.py"].

items.title: docker build .
items.description: To build the image.

items.title: docker run [image_id]
items.description: To run the container with a specific image ID.

items.title: docker run -it [image_id] bash
items.description: To access the container's terminal.

items.title: docker ps
items.description: To list running containers.

items.title: docker rm [container_id]
items.description: To remove a container.

items.title: docker rmi [image_id]
items.description: To remove an image.

items.title: Use Poetry
items.description: To manage dependencies within Docker. See Poetry Documentation.

items.title: WORKDIR /code
items.description: Set the working directory in Dockerfile.
